examples: Troops drove out the demonstrators.
Hunger drives the wolf out of the wood.
A stream of black cars drove by.
A stream of black cars drove by.
The waves drove against the shore.
words.defineEn: to control the movement and the speed of a car, bus, truck, etc. when it is moving
words.defineVi: để kiểm soát chuyển động và tốc độ của ô tô, xe buýt, xe tải, v.v. khi nó đang di chuyển

examples: The chef carefully arranged the arugula leaves on the plate as a beautiful garnish.
The child carefully planted caryopses of wildflowers in the garden.
The lioness carefully groomed her newborn baby.
Please drive carefully.
She carefully sprinkled sunflower seeds on top of her homemade bread dough.
words.defineEn: with a lot of care or attention
words.defineVi: với rất nhiều quan tâm hoặc chú ý

examples: The train’s here at long last.
The train traveled through beautiful countryside.
Trains between London and Brighton run throughout the day.
To hold the train.
The slow train arrived at the station behind schedule.
words.defineEn: to teach a specific skill or a type of behavior to a person or an animal by exercise and instruction over time
words.defineVi: để dạy một kỹ năng cụ thể hoặc một loại hành vi cho một người hoặc một con vật bằng cách tập thể dục và hướng dẫn theo thời gian

examples: This disaster comes hard on the heels of last week’s train crash.
The kids always work hard at school.
For Walter, disaster followed hard on the heels of his initial success.
Life on the road can be very hard.
She worked hard toward her degree.
words.defineEn: needing a lot of skill or effort to do
words.defineVi: cần rất nhiều kỹ năng hoặc nỗ lực để làm

examples: A true leader walks the talk.
The old lady walked slowly with the support of her cane.
The father proudly walked his daughter down the aisle on her wedding day.
They walk their dogs every day.
She walked the horse around the ring.
words.defineEn: to move forward at a regular speed by placing our feet in front of each other one by one
words.defineVi: di chuyển về phía trước với tốc độ đều đặn bằng cách đặt chân của chúng ta trước mặt nhau từng cái một

examples: The days passed slowly.
The day and night passed slowly.
The blades of the helicopter were turning slowly.
The old lady walked slowly with the support of her cane.
He slowly raised his head up.
words.defineEn: moving or doing something at a slow speed; not quickly
words.defineVi: di chuyển hoặc làm điều gì đó với tốc độ chậm; không nhanh chóng

examples: She explained the rules of the game to the new players.
Can you explain this math concept to me?
They explained the procedure for submitting the application form.
They explained the process of making a paper airplane step by step.
He explained the plot of the movie to his friend who hadn't seen it.
words.defineEn: to make something clear and easy to understand by giving more information about it
words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó rõ ràng và dễ hiểu bằng cách cung cấp thêm thông tin về nó

examples: That ship of yours clearly has had her day.
The photographs clearly show a broken window.
That resolution clearly withered on the vine.
She was clearly speaking the truth.
The witness was clearly lying through his teeth.
words.defineEn: with no doubt
words.defineVi: không có nghi ngờ

examples: Your car is waiting, sir.
C'm on the crowd is waiting.
We waited there for the better part of an hour.
What are you waiting for?
Leeds United had waited for success for eighteen years.
words.defineEn: to not leave until a person or thing is ready or present or something happens
words.defineVi: để không rời đi cho đến khi một người hoặc điều đã sẵn sàng hoặc hiện tại hoặc một cái gì đó xảy ra

examples: The waiter patiently answered our questions about the ingredients in the dish.
The fisherman patiently cast his line from the riverbank, hoping for a big catch.
They waited patiently while I got ready.
I listened patiently while she vented her spleen.
The children were as good as gold, waiting patiently at the entrance.
words.defineEn: in a manner that displays one's tolerance of difficulties, delays, and bad behaviors without becoming annoyed or angry
words.defineVi: theo cách thể hiện khả năng chịu đựng khó khăn, chậm trễ và hành vi xấu mà không trở nên khó chịu hay tức giận

examples: After all, love will find a way.
He loved gardening.
They loved the sun-dried tomato and mozzarella-filled pansotti.
I love the vibrant green color of Granny Smith apples.
I love the crunch of romaine lettuce in my sandwiches.
words.defineEn: to have very strong feelings for someone or something that is important to us and we like a lot and want to take care of
words.defineVi: có tình cảm rất mãnh liệt với ai đó hoặc điều gì đó quan trọng đối với chúng ta và chúng ta rất thích và muốn chăm sóc

examples: I really fell in love with dance very passionately at a young age.
That we have enormous enthusiasms, and we love deeply and passionately.
Mark and I went at it last week because we passionately disagree.
Mark and I went at it last week because we passionately disagree.
Art also gave me some thing to feel passionately about during a time when I otherwise felt pretty numb.
words.defineEn: in a manner that shows strong feeling or deep emotion
words.defineVi: theo cách thể hiện cảm xúc mạnh mẽ hoặc cảm xúc sâu sắc

examples: I shouldn't have behaved like that.
The teacher's stern grimace warned the students to behave.
Cutting him some slack won't make him behave more politely next time you know.
The sudden fame has turned her head, making her behave arrogantly and disregard others' opinions.
Sally's usually very well behaved, so I gave her a pass on this one.
words.defineEn: to act in a particular way
words.defineVi: hành động theo một cách cụ thể

examples: They both pay their employees badly.
This company badly needs to bring in some new blood.
The evening started badly when the speaker failed to turn up.
We've done very badly as far as planning is concerned.
Jack vented his spleen at his wife whenever things went badly at work.
words.defineEn: to a great or serious degree or extent
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ lớn hoặc nghiêm trọng hoặc mức độ

examples: Come rain or shine.
The party will be on Tuesday, rain or shine.
he sun shines brightly, lighting up the entire sky.
Rise and shine!
Rise and shine, sleepy head!
words.defineEn: to emit or reflect light or brightness
words.defineVi: để phát ra hoặc phản xạ ánh sáng hoặc độ sáng

examples: The stars twinkled brightly in the dark night sky.
he sun shines brightly, lighting up the entire sky.
Mayor Landrieu stands out against that backdrop very brightly.
The Sun is shining really brightly out there!
Supernovas also shine really brightly in UV.
words.defineEn: in a manner that emits a strong or intense light
words.defineVi: theo cách phát ra ánh sáng mạnh hoặc cường độ cao

examples: He rarely fought his political battles in the open.
Fighting like cats and dogs like always.
The children had pillow fights during their sleepover.
He has always fought the good fight against oppression.
A young cyclist is fighting for his life after the accident.
words.defineEn: to take part in a violent action, either physical or verbal, against someone
words.defineVi: tham gia vào một hành động bạo lực, thể chất hoặc lời nói, chống lại ai đó

examples: The firefighter bravely extinguished the house fire.
He bravely took a bite of the spicy chilli and instantly felt a fiery sensation in his mouth.
The child who was caught stealing apples bravely faced the music in accepting his punishment.
'It was my fault,' added Cathy bravely.
The Syrians fought bravely, but in the end they had to go back to Aleppo with nothing to show for their hard work.
words.defineEn: in a fearless manner that shows bravery or courage
words.defineVi: một cách không sợ hãi thể hiện sự dũng cảm hoặc can đảm

examples: His partner left the table in a fit of pique.
The spicy beef jerky left a smoky aftertaste in my mouth.
Red wine leaves a stain.
Leaves change colour in autumn.
The intense gaze from across the room, eyes on stalks, left no doubt about his attraction.
words.defineEn: to go away from somewhere or someone
words.defineVi: đi khỏi một nơi nào đó hoặc một ai đó

examples: Suddenly another soldier hits the dirt beside me.
My father died suddenly at the age of 48.
A man suddenly appeared from behind a tree.
Quite suddenly, her mind was made up.
Suddenly things started happening.
words.defineEn: quickly and unexpectedly
words.defineVi: một cách nhanh chóng và bất ngờ

examples: His voice dropped to a whisper.
Liam whispered sweet nothings into Jane's ear, making her blush and smile.
The old man looked at his wife of 50 years and whispered, 'To me, your beauty is only growing stronger with time.
The policeman whispered in Felix’s ear.
The word whispered round the Opera House.
words.defineEn: to speak very softly or quietly, usually to avoid being overheard by others who are nearby
words.defineVi: nói rất nhẹ nhàng hoặc lặng lẽ, thường là để tránh bị những người khác ở gần nghe thấy

examples: The bedside radio played softly.
The white snowflakes were falling softly from the sky during winter.
I speak softly and carry a big stick to maintain a peaceful atmosphere.
He sat in the corner, playing softly on his guitar.
Even though I was speaking very softly, Jill could read my lips and knew exactly what I was saying.
words.defineEn: in a manner that is gentle and pleasant
words.defineVi: một cách nhẹ nhàng và dễ chịu

examples: The old customs are dying.
All men must die.
The flowers died during a dry spell.
My father died suddenly at the age of 48.
The die is cast.
words.defineEn: to no longer be alive
words.defineVi: không còn sống

examples: A beautiful white horse grazed peacefully in the meadow.
The 1,400 fans were on their best behavior and filed out peacefully at the end.
We were lucky to witness a herd of elephants grazing peacefully in the savannah.
Catherine's dead body lay peacefully on her bed.
The election had unfolded relatively peacefully.
words.defineEn: in a calm and harmonious manner
words.defineVi: một cách bình tĩnh và hài hòa

examples: Rain is the kiss of death for a barbecue.
Come rain or shine.
The team rained down blows on their opponents, overwhelming them with a flurry of punches.
Could I take a rain check?
This rain looks as if it has set in for the rest of the day.
words.defineEn: water that falls in small drops from the sky
words.defineVi: nước rơi thành giọt nhỏ từ trên trời

examples: Mary's makeup was applied so heavily that it looked like she had a face that could stop a clock.
The company's decision to invest heavily in the new product was a kill or cure move.

The company that relies too heavily on a single product or service may be vulnerable to market changes or competition, demonstrating how the pitcher goes so often to the well that it is broken at last.
In a business environment, a playing field which is heavily regulated and favors established companies can make it challenging for new startups to compete and thrive.
Islamic narratives heavily influenced the perception of jinn and their characteristics.
words.defineEn: in large amounts or to a great degree
words.defineVi: với số lượng lớn hoặc ở mức độ lớn

examples: My grandmother made a dress for me.
The bride's wedding dress is white.
She bought an expensive dress for a special occasion.
Where did you buy that dress?
This dress makes me look fat.
words.defineEn: to put clothes on oneself
words.defineVi: tự mặc quần áo

examples: His frame spoke tiredness.
He spoke the final words of the play.
The brochure speaks of beautiful secluded grounds.
My mother spoke Russian.
Please speak more slowly.
words.defineEn: to use one's voice to express a particular feeling or to communicate information
words.defineVi: sử dụng giọng nói của một người để thể hiện một cảm giác cụ thể hoặc để truyền đạt thông tin

examples: Although she didn't speak the language fluently, she was able to get by with basic phrases and gestures.
He wants to become bilingual and speak multiple languages fluently.
Of course, not all deaf people can read English fluently.
It merges fluently with outer space, where there's no atmosphere at all.
People's opinions sway one way and ignore people who aren’t signing fluently.
words.defineEn: in an easy, effortless, and correct manner
words.defineVi: một cách dễ dàng, dễ dàng và chính xác

examples: His parents are always breathing down his neck.
I could barely breathe it was so funny.
My sister lives and breathes her yoga practice.
She eats, sleeps, and breathes painting.
As I live and breathe!
words.defineEn: to take air into one's lungs and let it out again
words.defineVi: để lấy không khí vào phổi của một người và cho nó ra một lần nữa

examples: She felt her mother's death very deeply.
We were deeply moved by her plight.
They are falling deeper into debt, and there is no light at the end of the tunnel.
I often have vivid dreams when I sleep deeply.
As a teacher, I encourage my students to think deeply and critically before asking questions, reminding them that 'a fool may ask more questions in an hour than a wise man can answer in seven years.'
words.defineEn: to a great degree; very much
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ tuyệt vời; rất nhiều

examples: The music was far too loud for my liking.
The branch broke with a loud snap.
The loud noise made me jump out of my skin.
He gave a loud cry and fell to the floor.
The loud crash made everyone in the room sit up and take notice.
words.defineEn: in a way that produces much noise
words.defineVi: theo cách tạo ra nhiều tiếng ồn

examples: In his mother’s eyes, the boy can do no wrong.
The journalist published a wrong statement in the article.
I accidentally hit the wrong key.
Unfortunately, the president struck the wrong note in his speech, ignoring the public mood.
She pressed the wrong button and accidentally deleted the file.
words.defineEn: in a way that is incorrect, inappropriate, or undesirable
words.defineVi: theo cách không chính xác, không phù hợp hoặc không mong muốn

examples: Sales are growing fast.
Things certainly move fast in the blogosphere.
He takes bends much too fast.
The fast runner won the race by a wide margin.
He's going too fast.
words.defineEn: in a rapid or quick way
words.defineVi: một cách nhanh chóng hoặc nhanh chóng

examples: The shopkeeper closed the shop for a short break.
The police closed in.
The business has already closed the books for this quarter.
Detectives had closed the book on the Hornsey Murders case three years previously.
The library closes early on Sundays.
words.defineEn: without much space between
words.defineVi: không có nhiều khoảng cách giữa

examples: For the first offence I was given a fine.
There's a fine line between humour and inappropriateness.
Our fine traditions give us a head start on the competition.
Farah ran a fine race to take the gold medal.
If he wants to play a game of cat and mouse, fine, I'll play.
words.defineEn: in a manner that is acceptable or satisfactory
words.defineVi: trong một cách đó là chấp nhận được hoặc thỏa đáng

examples: Right, pin back your ears, everyone.
That extension is busy right now.
I want a dish of creamy mushroom bucatini with Parmesan right now.
Right by holding the candle to the devil.
After the traffic lights, turn right.
words.defineEn: in an accurate manner
words.defineVi: một cách chính xác

examples: She guessed the answer straight away.
The guard stood straight as a ramrod.
They clicked straight away.
He gives it to you straight.
Sometimes he spoke straight from the shoulder and sometimes in puzzles
words.defineEn: in a manner that is not curved
words.defineVi: theo cách không cong

examples: After that, things moved forward at lightning speed.
We'll take the matter forward at our next meeting.
My children look forward to receiving gifts during the winter holidays.
He took a big step forward to start his new adventure.
He leaned forward to take her hand.
words.defineEn: to or toward the front
words.defineVi: đến hoặc về phía trước

examples: Spring came late this year.
Her latest novel takes the lid off the international art world.
The government's latest proposals are a dog's dinner.
She was only five minutes late!
The latest smartphone is now on the market.
words.defineEn: after the usual or expected time
words.defineVi: sau thời gian bình thường hoặc dự kiến

examples: Mask shortages mean that healthcare workers are having trouble getting a hold of masks, which puts everyone at risk.
There is certainly no shortage of resentment in the rest of Asia about the way China throws its weight about these days.
The shortage killed hundreds of them.
But bike companies are facing a problem: a shortage of bikes.
One analysis sees a shortage of 34,000 pilots by 2025, almost 10% of the workforce.
words.defineEn: a state where there is not enough of something or someone
words.defineVi: một trạng thái mà không có đủ của một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

examples: The results were kind of alarming.
Those stats are kind of alarming.
Yes, the numbers are alarming.
This sounds alarming.
That sounds alarming!
words.defineEn: frightening because of an awareness of danger
words.defineVi: đáng sợ vì nhận thức được sự nguy hiểm

examples: Narrator: Musk and SpaceX president Gwynne Shotwell say that much money could single-handedly fund the development of Starlink, Starship, and SpaceX's Mars-launch infrastructure.

And so in the early months, there is a dip in the number of border crossers, and the president I think is sort of quite satisfied and thinks that he single-handedly has completely changed immigration patterns in the region.

So if God knew you were going to eat the whole pie, then you couldn’t not eat the pie, because if you decided not to at the last minute, then you would have just proven God wrong, thereby single-handedly stripping him of his divine omniscience!
words.defineEn: without assistance
words.defineVi: không có sự trợ giúp

examples: Running the animal shelter is a labor of love for Jane.
They will have to sleep rough tonight if they don't find a shelter soon.
Reindeer moss, with its tufted form, provides a cozy bed for small creatures seeking shelter.

The family who lost their home in a natural disaster had to live in a temporary shelter for several months, but they endured the difficult circumstances with patience and resilience, knowing that what cannot be cured must be endured.
Sally is an animal lover, so when she found out that her new neighbor volunteers at an animal shelter, she knew he was after her own heart.
words.defineEn: to seek protection or safety from harm or danger
words.defineVi: để tìm kiếm sự bảo vệ hoặc an toàn khỏi bị tổn hại hoặc nguy hiểm

examples: She was weeping and her nose was running.
As the team celebrated their early lead, the coach reminded them that he that sings on Friday shall weep on Sunday, warning them not to get too complacent.
Some men will weep openly this day.
Even the Furies, the demonic goddesses of vengeance, wept.
- She was weeping uncontrollably.
words.defineEn: shed tears because of sadness, rage, or pain
words.defineVi: rơi nước mắt vì buồn bã, tức giận hoặc đau đớn

examples: Soon after, the barren planet crosses Mercury's orbit.
A superhabitable planet would do away with these barren landscapes to support more species and more diversity.
Which is a lot of action for a barren rock with no air!
Deforestation may turn lush tropics into a barren patch, like a successful ensemble breaking up after losing its star performers.
At the north edge of Santa Rosa city limits, you will find a barren lot marked by charred stumps and an empty pool.
words.defineEn: (of land or soil) not capable of producing any plants
words.defineVi: (của đất hoặc đất) không có khả năng sản xuất bất kỳ loại cây nào

examples: You can enjoy the natural sweetness of a ripe peach by biting into it and letting the juice drip down your chin.
The roof of the old house leaked during the rainstorm, and water dripped down from the ceiling.
You just dripped some juice.
That's a drip.
I don't like drip coffee.
words.defineEn: (particularly of water) to fall in small amounts of droplets
words.defineVi: (đặc biệt là nước) rơi thành từng giọt nhỏ

examples: He was a logger.
told, the Guardians capture seven loggers.
I'm sitting here with Admiral Logger
First the loggers come in and cut down all of the valuable trees.
First, though, they have to pass through the town of Arame, a notorious base for illegal loggers just outside of Guajajara territory.
words.defineEn: a person who fells trees
words.defineVi: một người ngã cây

examples: The fertile soil in this region yields abundant crops of wheat and corn.
The farmer harvested a bountiful crop of watermelons from his fields.
The study analyzed the yield of various crops across different regions, providing valuable insights for agricultural planning.
The land is used to grow crops.
More land was needed to grow crops for export.
words.defineEn: all the fruit, wheat, etc. harvested during a season
words.defineVi: tất cả trái cây, lúa mì, v.v. được thu hoạch trong một mùa

examples: I've already accomplished several things on my bucket list, but there's still more to do.
He focused on the meat and potatoes of his job, accomplishing tasks efficiently and effectively.
By this time next year, we will have stood fast and accomplished our goals.
Stepping into the shoes of your master is not an easy task to accomplish.
Sarah is getting on for 40, and she's already accomplished so much in her career.
words.defineEn: to successfully finish doing something after experiencing difficulties
words.defineVi: để hoàn thành thành công làm một cái gì đó sau khi gặp khó khăn
